intervention: Urban local symbiosis strategy
mitigation_strategy_cat: Waste to energy, energy from waste
study_subject_detail: Scenario 1: Extending the biogas recovery facility to a mechanization facility through a selective collection of organic waste for energy production. This energy will be used in heating, kitchen, and lighting with a recovery of 6% for the methanization facility operation. Fermentation residues are used as fertilizers.
model: Systematic modeling: Material Flow Analysis (MFA) and Life Cycle Analysis (LCA) + Simulation (with scenarios)
impact_components: (1) the waste flow produced in the system; (2) collection; (3) transport of collected waste to transforming plants; (4) transformation and recovery of energy; (5) distribution of the recovered energy to the applicant subsystems (users).
policy_note: Low Carbon Urban Symbioisis (LC-UrS) under the Algiers Master Plan "PDAU" strategic guidelines
name: Algiers
mitigation_stratcat_t2: Waste to energy, energy from waste

impact_components: Implementing pilot scale composting to food waste, and implementing composting to green waste
policy_note: In the Iskandar Malaysia Region located in the Johor State, Malaysia, a series of low-carbon initiatives have been imple- mented within the local communities. name: Layang-Layang village, Iskandar

intervention: Using only solar generated energy to meet the require 12.5% of renewable energy generation for NC's RPS goals.
study_subject_detail: investor-owned utility systems in North Carolina
policy_note: In an effort to reduce emissions, North Carolina implemented a policy known as Renewable Portfolio Standard. This policy required that a set amount of a states electricity generated must come from renewable energy. With this policy, North Carolina required that 12.5% of electricity generated must come from renewable energy by 2021.
name: North Carolina
